INV-001.name: No Hostile Admission
INV-001.description: No intent classified as hostile by any ENFORCING layer may be admitted to execution
INV-001.formalDefinition: ∀ intent i: (∃ layer L ∈ ENFORCING: L.classifies(i) = HOSTILE) → verdict(i) = REJECT

INV-002.name: No Unexplained Verdict
INV-002.description: Every verdict must have a complete causal chain from detection to decision
INV-002.formalDefinition: ∀ verdict v: attribution(v) ≠ ∅ ∧ ∀ rule r ∈ triggered(v): explanation(r) ≠ ∅

INV-003.name: Order Invariance
INV-003.description: Pipeline layer ordering must not affect final verdict
INV-003.formalDefinition: ∀ intent i, ∀ permutation π of layers: verdict(pipeline(i)) = verdict(π(pipeline)(i))
INV-003.note: Verified for HCA-1, PIL-1, HIC-1 orderings

INV-004.name: Capability Monotonicity
INV-004.description: Adding detection capabilities must not reduce detection coverage
INV-004.formalDefinition: ∀ capability set C, C' where C ⊂ C': coverage(C') ≥ coverage(C)
INV-004.note: New rules may only expand detection, never contract

INV-005.name: Explanation Entropy Minimum
INV-005.description: Explanation diversity must remain above threshold to prevent single-rule dominance
